If you're looking for a film set in Africa, I'd highly recommend "Tsotsi" (2005). This movie tells a compelling story about a young Johannesburg gang leader and his life over six intense days. It stars Kenneth Nkosi and Terry Pheto, two talented actors who deliver powerful performances.

On the other hand, if you're interested in an adventure set in Rio de Janeiro, "Heart of Darkness" (1910) is a classic film noir that follows a police officer on a dangerous mission to find a missing captain under mysterious circumstances. It may not be set in Africa as per your initial preference, but it's still a captivating watch!

Based on your preference for war movies and a hint of intrigue, I'd recommend you watch "Flags of Our Fathers". It tells the true story of six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima during World War II, and features an impressive cast including Ryan Phillippe, Paul Walker, and Joseph Cross.

Another movie that might catch your interest is "Pan's Labyrinth", a fantasy-horror film set in Spain during the Civil War. Starring Ivana Baquero and Maribel Verdú, it tells the story of a young girl who escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world to deal with the harsh realities around her.

I'd highly recommend watching "The Messenger" if you're interested in exploring a war story with a profound emotional depth. It stars Ben Foster, Woody Harrelson, and Samantha Morton, who deliver powerful performances as they navigate the complexities of love, loss, and duty during wartime.

If you're looking for a different perspective on war and human connection, "In the Land of Blood and Honey" might also be of interest. Directed by Angelina Jolie, it offers a poignant exploration of relationships between Serbs and Bosnians amidst the backdrop of the Bosnian War. Enjoy your movie time!
